alert.note: Alert for Caroline; Kent; Queen Anne's; Talbot (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued April 12 at 3:28AM EDT until April 12 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM EDT THIS MORNING THROUGH THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE EASTERN SHORES OF MARYLAND... * AFFECTED AREA...Kent MD, Queen Annes, Talbot and Caroline. * TIMING...Wednesday. * WINDS...West 10 to 15 mph with gusts of 20 to 25 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 27 percent. * TEMPERATURES...High temperatures this afternoon in the upper 70s and lower 80s. * IMPACTS...Critical fire weather conditions are expected. There will be increased risk for rapid wildfire growth and spread.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur due to a combination of strong winds, low relative humidities, and dry fuels. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings. For more information about wildfire danger, burn restrictions, and wildfire prevention and education, please visit your state forestry or environmental protection website.
